codeGenerator.title: Generate Protection Code

pageInstructions.step2: 2. Paste it into the <head> section of your protected page
pageInstructions.step3: 3. The entire page will be protected automatically

elementInstructions.step1: 1. Add the script tag to your page <head>
elementInstructions.step2: 2. Wrap content you want to protect with data-gatekeeper-product="{slug}"
elementInstructions.step3: 3. Add fallback content with data-no-access for users without access
elementInstructions.step4: 4. The script will automatically show/hide content based on user access

codeGenerator.frontendProtectionDescription: This solution operates entirely on the client-side, making it compatible with any website builder like WordPress, Webflow, Squarespace, or static HTML. While this approach is less secure than server-side protection, we've implemented several obfuscation techniques to make circumvention more challenging than typical frontend solutions.
codeGenerator.pageModeUseCase: Perfect for protecting landing pages, course content, or any standalone page where you want to control access based on user purchases or subscriptions.
codeGenerator.selectiveDisplayDescription: This method allows you to show or hide specific sections of a page based on user access. It's particularly useful for sales pages where you want to display different content to paying customers versus prospects.
codeGenerator.implementationDescription: Add data-gatekeeper-product="{slug}" to content that should be visible to users with access, and data-no-access="true" to fallback content for users without access. The script will automatically manage visibility.
codeGenerator.elementModeUseCase: Replace "Buy Now" buttons with "Access Product" buttons for existing customers, or show premium content sections only to subscribers.

validation.email: Please enter a valid email address
validation.invalidSlug: Slug can only contain lowercase letters, numbers, and hyphens

form.temporalAvailabilityDescription: Leave both fields empty for permanent availability. Set only "Available From" for products launching in the future. Set only "Available Until" for limited-time offers.
form.accessExpireAfter: When users gain access to this product, their access will automatically expire after this many days. Leave empty for permanent access.
form.autoGrantDurationDescription: This setting applies to automatic access grants (e.g., free products, purchases). Manual access grants through the admin panel can override this setting.
form.redirectDescription: URL to redirect users after gaining access.

stripe.title: Stripe Configuration
stripe.subtitle: Manage your Stripe API keys and payment integration settings

env.title: Currently using: .env configuration
env.description: Your Stripe is configured via STRIPE_SECRET_KEY environment variable. This is perfectly fine for developers, Docker deployments, and CI/CD.
env.alternative: üí° Alternative: You can optionally use the wizard below to manage keys via database with encrypted storage, visual guides, and automatic validation.

database.title: Currently using: Database configuration
database.description: Your Stripe keys are securely encrypted with AES-256-GCM and stored in the database.
database.alternative: üí° Alternative: Developers can also configure Stripe via STRIPE_SECRET_KEY in .env file.

infoBox.title: ‚ÑπÔ∏è Two Configuration Methods
infoBox.method1: Method 1 (.env): Set STRIPE_SECRET_KEY - recommended for developers, Docker, CI/CD
infoBox.method2: Method 2 (Database wizard): Use the wizard above - recommended for non-technical users, includes visual guides and validation
infoBox.footer: Both methods are equally supported. Choose what works best for you.

wizard.title: Stripe Configuration
wizard.subtitle: Configure your Stripe Restricted API Key

confirmExit.title: Exit configuration?
confirmExit.message: Your progress has been saved. You can continue later from where you left off.

step1.title: Secure Stripe Integration
step1.subtitle: Configure your Stripe API keys using Restricted API Keys (RAK) for maximum security

whatIsRAK.title: What are Restricted API Keys?
whatIsRAK.description: Restricted API Keys (RAK) allow you to grant specific permissions to your application, following the principle of least privilege. Instead of using full access keys, you only grant the permissions GateFlow actually needs.
whatIsRAK.recommendedText: for self-hosted integrations and production environments.

encrypted.title: Encrypted Storage
encrypted.description: Your API keys are encrypted with AES-256-GCM before being stored in the database.

guided.title: Guided Setup
guided.description: Step-by-step instructions with visual guides to create your Restricted API Key in Stripe.

validation.title: Automatic Validation
validation.description: We automatically test your key and verify it has all required permissions.

rotation.title: Key Rotation Reminders
rotation.description: Get reminded every 90 days to rotate your keys for security best practices.

alternative.title: Alternative: .env Configuration
alternative.description: Developers can also configure Stripe by setting STRIPE_SECRET_KEY directly in .env file. Both methods are equally supported.

step2.title: Choose Environment Mode
step2.subtitle: Select whether you want to configure Test or Live mode

test.title: Test Mode
test.description: Use test mode to safely practice and verify your integration without processing real payments.

live.title: Live Mode
live.description: Use live mode for your production environment to accept real payments from customers.

info.title: You can configure both later
info.description: You can set up both Test and Live mode separately. Start with Test mode to practice, then add Live mode when ready for production.

step3.title: Create Your Restricted API Key
step3.subtitle: Follow these steps to create a secure Restricted API Key in Stripe

openDashboard.title: Step 1: Open Stripe Dashboard
openDashboard.description: Click below to open the API Keys page in a new tab

step2.title: Create a Restricted Key
step2.description: In the Stripe dashboard, click "Create restricted key" button (not "Create secret key")

step3.title: Name Your Key
step3.description: Give your key a descriptive name, for example:

step4.title: Set Required Permissions
step4.description: Configure the following permissions for GateFlow to work properly:
step4.importantText: Required permissions are marked with ‚ö†Ô∏è. Without these, GateFlow will not function properly.

step5.title: Create & Copy the Key
step5.description: Click "Create key" and immediately copy it. You will paste it in the next step.
step5.warning: The key is only shown once! Make sure to copy it.

step4.title: Enter Your API Key
step4.subtitle: Paste the Restricted API Key you created in Stripe

input.label: Stripe API Key
input.help: Your key will be encrypted with AES-256-GCM before being stored.

permissions.title: Missing Required Permissions
permissions.help: Go back to Stripe and update your key permissions.

success.title: API Key Validated Successfully!
success.description: Your key has been verified and all required permissions are granted.

step5.title: Configuration Complete!
step5.subtitle: Your Stripe integration is now configured and ready to use

security.title: Encrypted & Secure
security.description: Your API key has been encrypted with AES-256-GCM and securely stored in the database.

rotation.title: Rotation Reminder Set
rotation.description: You'll receive a reminder in 90 days to rotate your API key as a security best practice.

nextSteps.title: üí° Next Steps
nextSteps.test: Test your integration with Stripe test card numbers
nextSteps.verify: Verify that payments are processing correctly in test mode
nextSteps.live: When ready for production, configure Live mode using the same wizard

live.title: üéâ You're Live!
live.description: Your Stripe integration is now configured for production. You can accept real payments from customers.
live.reminder: Make sure you have properly configured your webhook endpoints and tested all payment flows.

step5.finePrint: You can always update or rotate your API keys from the Settings page.
